item.title: Director, Data Science
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

As a Director specializing in data science, you’ll be responsible for building the strategy and complex advanced models and AI capabilities for CIBC’s products, services and processes. The Director will also be capable of leading teams of Data Engineers and Software Developers who will leverage their Big Data skills to develop data assets that can be leveraged by the data science team to build advanced models and AI capabilities.

This role is a senior position within the Analytics team and requires a hands-on approach to solving problems, planning and managing change related to all aspects of the client-facing roles related to Analytics and AI initiatives. 

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role you’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Champion the use of advanced analytics for solving business problems: Work with various business units to understand their needs, opportunities and pain points.

  • Successfully manage and deliver on key analytical initiatives: Work across the various CIBC lines of business.

  • Oversee and complete the implementation and evaluation of proposed models: Create and validate statistical and ML based approaches that deal with complex data sets.

  • Work closely with business subject matter experts: Understand the context of business problems, perform deep dives on data collection and transformations and develop novel features to enhance model performance.

  • See analytics work through to completion: Oversee the model deployment and handoff to the line of business.

  • Support modelling efforts: Periodically refresh or revise as business needs evolve.

  • Become the trusted analytical partner for the leadership of the various CIBC lines of business: Focus on client / partner satisfaction. Mentor junior data scientists on modelling and coding best practices, as well as coaching on how to make analytical work relevant to business partners.

  • Help teams in Advanced Analytics tell a business story: Develop executive presentations that will support their initiatives.

  • Provide subject matter expertise on business analytics: Integrate and align business initiatives with Advance Analytics mandates and objectives.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate advanced knowledge of decision science, data science, advanced modelling and advanced analytical techniques.

  • You have extensive hands-on experience with modern data science and machine learning languages and toolkits including: Python, Pandas, scikit-learn, XGBoost, Tensorflow, Pytorch, SQL. Additionally, you have strong coding skills, knowledge of DevOps tooling and and experience with one or more cloud services.

  • You’re a certified professional. You have an M.S. or Ph.D. in Mathematics, Computer Science, Electrical and Computer Engineering, or equivalent degree.

  • You\'re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.

  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning and comprehensive product training

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.  

Job Location

Toronto-CC North 26th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

item.title: Sr. Manager, Advanced Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You\'ll Be Doing

Reporting to Director, Advanced Analytics, Risk Insights and Monitoring, you will be a senior contributor for developing and delivering on the Advanced Analytics team’s technical solution strategies and commitment to develop, support, and continuously improve analytics capabilities through the delivery of data analytics services. The Senior Manager is expected to lead the technical design and development of key analytics projects, and will assist the execution and delivery of advanced analytics strategy.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.

How You\'ll Succeed

  • Leverage Advanced Analytics- Modeling, and statistical knowledge to design, implement, and deliver analytics engagements in support of Business Controls. Actively lead complex advanced analytics engagements to ensure quality, depth of analysis, and clearly communicated and insightful results.   
  • Provide Technical, Motivational and Strategic- Thought leadership to the Advanced Analytics team in planning, developing and executing enhanced data analysis to support all parts of the Business Controls function.
  • Lead the Technical Solution Design and Development of new and ongoing projects using predictive/analytical algorithms and statistical data modeling tools to derive meaningful and actionable insights from data to support Business Controls activities.
  • Design and Create Interactive Dashboards to support visual analytics projects and create continuous monitoring and control testing programs, data profiles and KPI/KRI dashboards.
  • Work with internal stakeholders to develop best practice in data infrastructure to enable new analytics. Generate statistical outputs and translate into business context for presentation and discussion with stakeholders.
  • Develop technical templates and documentation standards to ensure all work products are standardized and effectively delivered. Continually improve sustainable internal methods, standards, processes, and practices for delivery of data management and data analytics services.
  • Collaborate with other consultants and leaders in the CIBC analytics community to identify and realize points of integration to deliver coordinated analytics services.

Who you are

  • Completed a degree (preferably at the graduate level) in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Quantitative Finance or related sciences. Strategic and systematic thinker with a strong analytical and process development background.
  • 5+ years of experience and advanced practical and theoretical knowledge in specialized areas of responsibility, including data analytics, quantitative modeling, AI/ML/NLP, BI and statistical analysis.
  • Demonstrated experience using advanced analytical, data management and visualization tools: SAS, Tableau, Python, R, SQL, Oracle RDBMS. Knowledge of CIBC data sources, applications and system platforms is a benefit.
  • Exceptional communication skills (both written and oral) with experience turning data into insights and presenting complex technical ideas and sensitive findings to business stakeholders
  • Strong organization, leadership, and team-oriented skills. Demonstrated ability to collaborate as well as lead across a matrix organization to execute on priorities, influence change and deliver results.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.

item.title: Senior Manager, Secured Lending Analytics (RESL)
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing­­

The Senior Manager, Secured Lending Analytics will be a leading contributor in the Analytics & Decision Science team supporting Personal and Business Banking Real Estate Secured Lending product line. The Analytics & Decision Science team focuses on creating next generation analytics assets to enable data-driven decision making for partners in Product, Marketing, Client Segment and Strategy. In this role, you will lead analytics engagements to evaluate client behaviours and optimize business decisions related to product, campaign, pricing and other business areas. You will present insights and make data-driven recommendations to senior leaders to help identify opportunities to grow the business and better serve our clients.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview

How You’ll Succeed

  • Consultant – be a leader and subject matter expert in Real Estate Secured Lending– Integrate deep domain knowledge with analytical capabilities to deliver value to stakeholders, enable data-driven decision making and proactively identify opportunities to drive business growth (projects/business cases, acquisition/retention campaigns, pricing, channels, segments, products and process enhancements

  • Analytics – Independently identify and leverage the right statistical techniques (descriptive, predictive, prescriptive) to extract actionable insights out of client behaviours and business trends (both internal and external).  Appropriately integrate of big data, business intelligence, visualization, self-service and analytical tools into engagements.  Proactively explore new applications of advanced analytics to innovate and build strategic analytics assets.

  • Technology – Leverage big data/analytical tools to analyze large structured and unstructured datasets, build data pipeline and visualization from multiple data sources.

  • Ownership – Orchestrate end-to-end delivery of solutions that meet stakeholder requirements and contribute to business success – you will think and act like an owner in analytics initiatives ensuring the proper identification and translation of business needs into analytics requirements.

  • Communication – Find the story in data and be flexible in communicating at varying levels of details for the right audience.

Who You Are

  • You have a degree in a quantitative field (i.e. mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, engineering, physics, business) or equivalent experience. Advanced degree is an asset (i.e. MMA, MBAN, MSc, MA, MBA).

  • You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business problems and recommend solutions.

  • You are proficient in programming languages and have experience using modern big data, analytical and dashboard tools (i.e. SAS, SQL, Python, R, Hadoop, Spark, Alteryx, Tableau, Cognos).

  • You have experience in building end-to-end analytics solutions involving large datasets (i.e. requirement gathering, data extraction, cleaning and transformation, statistical analysis, presentation & implementation).

  • You have working knowledge of statistical techniques (i.e. regression, time-series analysis, clustering, decision trees).

  • You are an avid learner who recognizes the analytics field is constantly evolving. You seek to explore emerging trends and best practices in the industry and are excited to share the knowledge with others.

  • You can be clearly understood. You have very strong communication and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present information to groups and individuals at all levels in the organization.

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.

  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

item.title: Consultant, Data Governance
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

The Data Governance & Management team is responsible for proactive management and governance of all PBB Data assets. This includes leading and managing all Data Governance activities and ensuring PBB is in compliance with both internal and external policies & procedures. The team is also responsible for helping analytics teams in PBB better leverage data by helping them get the data needed for their analysis. In short, this team enables PBB with good quality data.

You’ll join our Analytics & Decision Science team reporting into the Director, Data Management & Governance. As a Business Consultant, you’ll support all Personal & Business Banking (PBB) data governance activities and will have responsibility for improving the quality and managing the protection of sensitive data and information assets. You’ll focus on ensuring adherence to the data governance policies and procedures and have a direct impact on the business by helping to implement and maintain business processes for successful data governance and quality within PBB.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview

How You’ll Succeed

  • Data Governance – Support the classification of data elements and identification of critical data elements. Maintain inventory of PBB applications and data governance roles. Maintain a list of roles and responsibilities related to data governance and ensure clear accountability for stewardship of the company’s principal information assets in accordance with Enterprise Data Governance policies. Support the remediation of data governance deficiencies across PBB.  Contribute towards ongoing data quality improvement initiatives.
  • Compliance & Adherence - Monitor performance and quality metrics and ensure compliance with data related policies, standards, roles and responsibilities, and adoption requirements. Monitor adherence to data policies across the organization to ensure availability of high-quality data, consultative and subject matter expertise, ensuring all users of data understand policies, procedures and standards.
  • Project Management – Responsible for the execution of work streams under our data governance project and the ongoing maintenance and monitoring of data governance activities to ensure that PBB remains in compliance. Assist to roll out PBB wide data governance framework, with a focus on improvement of data quality and the protection of sensitive data through modifications to organization behavior policies and standards, principles, governance metrics, processes, related tools and data architecture. Contribute to successful completion of data governance project deliverables.  Participate in project and team meetings, interact and collaborate with team members and other departments as appropriate

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate a minimum of 3 years’ experience in supporting data governance procedures including measuring/monitoring data quality, recommending improvements in data, data classification and data governance capabilities. You have 2 years’ experience working with Personal Banking products including the experience and knowledge of data governance in a cross-functional environment of multiple data sources/repositories. It’s recommended that you have at least one year of experience in process engineering.
  • You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business problems and recommend solutions.
  • You can be clearly understood. You have very strong communication and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present information to groups and individuals at all levels in the organization.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

The Advanced Analytics & AI team is a central hub of data science expertise within CIBC, and is leading the way in applying the best practices in predictive science, machine learning, leveraging massive datasets and the latest in big data technology platforms. We engage in collaborations with the leading academic institutes in the space of AI and machine learning to promote the exchange of ideas and enrich our talent.

The Director of Advanced Analytics & Insights will be focusing on the HR portfolio, bringing to life advanced analytics for strategic people metrics, to drive insights that inform key decisions and areas of focus that should be prioritized within the HR function. You will have a strong relationship with senior leaders to understand business problems, challenges and opportunities. Your expertise will allow shape horizontal use cases across multiple HR disciples, bringing forward predictive insights into forecasting trends on critical KPIs such as turnover, hiring, absenteeism, employee engagement, strategic workforce planning, etc. You’ll work with structured and unstructured data to produce end-to-end solutions, taking models from development into deployment.  

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role you’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

item.title: Consultant, Risk Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You\'ll Be Doing

  • Support the development of proposals/business cases for credit risk scorecards, system or rule changes that will enhance credit risk management performance.
  • Conduct pre and post-analyses of acquisition strategy performance.  Provide objective and sound feedback on the performance of acquisition strategies.  Make specific recommendations to improve future performance.
  • Quantify and grade risk-adjusted profit as well as credit risk performance.
  • Actively monitor the performance of key origination strategies.  Alert senior management to any signs of potential emerging risk or performance degradation.
  • Build deep subject matter knowledge of (i) TTD adjudication system rules, tables and cutoffs and (ii) acquisition campaign criteria.  Assess the merits of adjudication cutoffs and rules logic for TTD and campaign channels.  Ensure that cutoffs align with RACD’s risk appetite.
  • Play a lead role in managing the TTD decision engine simulation environment.
  • Ensure accuracy and integrity of data throughout the analytical process.  Play a lead role in continuously improving the breadth and quality of available data.
  • Invoke champion/challenger methodologies as appropriate.
  • Build and maintain sound working relationships with key business partner groups such as Product Management, Technology, etc.
  • Design and build new tracking and reporting capabilities to evaluate strategy performance.

How You\'ll Succeed

  • The candidate would be required to have extensive knowledge of how to develop dynamic dashboards, charts and graphs that senior leadership can drill down into and use to understand trends.
  • Experience in Excel Pivot tables, calculations, graphs and charts is essential and candidate must be able to customize these as requested by team.
  • Being able to develop dynamic dashboards (in Tableau/PowerBI) that can be used for different types of views into the data.
  • The candidate must be comfortable with advanced SQL queries and must be able to use SQL to draw relevant data, integrate it and clean it in a data hub environment.
  • The Candidate should have an in-depth knowledge of how to work in SAS and should be comfortable understanding existing SAS code and developing their own SAS queries to pull, integrate and output data.
  • Strong experience in Python is essential and the candidate must be able to manipulate and analyze large, complex datasets in addition to being able to build their own datasets from existing data sources.
  • Knowledge of Data science and Analytics concepts is essential as candidate will be expected to support model development efforts in the Risk Modelling sphere.
  • Experience with models like Decision Trees. Random Forest, XG Boost as well as associated concepts such as hyper parameter tuning, model validation and model monitoring.
  • Must be comfortable communicating complex ideas during presentations in a simple and concise manner to facilitate understanding.
  • Should be able to use data and visuals to derive narratives that explain trends and insights.
  • A strong grasp of financial terms used in Risk as well as their interpretation is strongly preferred.
  • Candidate must be able to understand and interpret complex financial data as well as spot any anomalies and inconsistencies in financial data.
  • Comfortable working in Excel and Python to perform complex financial calculations that are dynamically updated with new inputs.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in principles of credit analysis and risk management relating to retail lending portfolios.  Prior experience in retail credit is an asset.
  • You have a strong financial background and can understand financial information in the portfolio as well as spot and explain anomalies.
  • Ability to interpret and analyze information to formulate solutions.  Strong problem solving skills evidenced by a proven track record.
  • Experience with acquisition risk strategy development, including implementation via automated risk management systems such as Decision Manager, Capstone is an asset.
  • Knowledge of advanced Excel functionality including pivot tables and charts, string manipulation, lookups, and filters.
  • Knowledge of at least one dashboarding software (Tableau, PowerBI etc.)
  • Strong experience in Python, SAS and SQL is a pre-requisite.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • You\'re passionate about people. You find meaning in relationships, and surround yourself with a diverse network of partners. You build trust through respect and authenticity.
  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

  • Analytics – You identify and leverage the right statistical techniques (descriptive, predictive, prescriptive) to extract actionable insights out of client behaviours and business trends (both internal and external).  You appropriately integrate of big data, business intelligence, visualization, self-service and analytical tools into engagements.  You proactively explore new applications of advanced analytics to innovate and build strategic analytics assets.

  • Demonstrated experience using advanced analytical, data management and visualization tools: SAS, Tableau, Python, R, SQL, Oracle RDBMS. Knowledge of CIBC data sources, applications and system platforms is a benefit.
  • Exceptional communication skills (both written and oral) with experience turning data into insights and presenting complex technical ideas and sensitive findings to business stakeholders
  • Strong organization, leadership, and team-oriented skills. Demonstrated ability to collaborate as well as lead across a matrix organization to execute on priorities, influence change and deliver results.

item.title: Consultant, Risk Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Small Business Risk Management, the successful candidate will be well versed in designing, building and implementing account acquisition and account management strategies with a focus on increasing auto-approval rates and decreasing loss rates. Expert level SAS SQL coding skills are required to extract value from data combined with strong communication skills for presentation of risk-reward analysis to Senior Management. Reporting (standard and ad hoc) will require attention to detail and accuracy.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Data driven - Actively work with other business partners across the organization to ensure that work is aligned to our mandate and objectives.   Lead and support in-depth client insights studies using SAS, and create an analytical framework to help solve key business questions and test hypotheses. A strong understanding of reporting, analysis and data mining combined with  practical industry experience is required.
    • Support the development of proposals/business cases for credit risk scorecards, system or rule changes that will enhance credit risk management performance
    • Conduct pre and post-analyses of strategy performance.  Provide objective and sound feedback on the performance of acquisition strategies.  Make specific recommendations to improve future performance
    • Build deep subject matter knowledge of (i) TTD adjudication system rules, tables and cutoffs and (ii) acquisition campaign criteria. 
    • Experience in Excel Pivot tables, calculations, graphs and charts is essential and candidate must be able to customize these as requested by team
  • Continuous improvement mindset - Strong focus on process improvement. Regularly identify, develop and implement operational process enhancements with the goal of improving efficiencies and synergies between internal and external partners.
  • Communication and relationship management - Lead and assist in preparing comprehensive presentations as needed to highlight key insights from deep dive analysis along with any recommendations that can be adopted to help address gaps or opportunities.  Manage a number of high priority requests to support management in order to support the bank’s strategy. Interact and work effectively across multiple internal teams, and establish a process to facilitate data/information sharing that ensures a consistent, common understanding of key client metrics.
    • A strong grasp of financial terms used in Risk as well as their interpretation is strongly preferred.
  • Critical thinking - Apply critical thinking, creativity and sound judgement to identify issues and opportunities.  You can sort through complex and ambiguous scenarios to understand root causes and make tough but reasoned choices between competing alternatives and opinions.  You seek to understand before proposing solutions and although you intuitively know something doesn’t make sense, you rely on data and fact to inform decisions and recommendations rather than opinion. Openly and frequently share your knowledge, ideas and views because you know your perspective matters.
  • Project execution - Own and lead projects from inception to execution – such as, working with all stakeholders across the organization to develop a holistic client contribution framework & assessment to the automation of the entire process. Stay abreast of industry best practices regarding analytical methods and technologies.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in at least 3-5 years’ experience and strong skills in data extraction/manipulation and statistical analysis tools, including SAS SQL (required); comfort with exploring how new and emerging data can be used; Knowledge of data visualization tools such as COGNOS, Tableau, etc. is an asset. Working in applied data & analytics problems in business banking and/or retail banking is an asset.  Experience creating Access/VBA based reporting databases is an strong asset. Experience is developing business requirements documents and solutions requirements documents with Technology is an asset.
    • The candidate must be comfortable with advanced SQL queries and must be able to use SQL to draw relevant data, integrate it and clean it in a data hub environment.
    • The Candidate should have an in-depth knowledge of how to work in SAS and should be comfortable understanding existing SAS code and developing their own SAS queries to pull, integrate and output data.
    • Candidate must be able to understand and interpret complex financial data as well as spot any anomalies and inconsistencies in financial data
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • You have a degree/diploma in a relevant bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or quantitative discipline such as Applied Statistics; related banking/business/finance knowledge is considered an asset
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

Job Description

SR CONSULTANT, INFRASTRUCTURE DATA ANALYTICS - Outsourced Technology and Cloud Services

We’re on a mission to build the relationship-focused bank of the future and we’re looking for the passionate collaborators, innovators, advisors, and leaders who can get us there. Our distinct culture is built on a shared commitment to do what’s right for our clients, our people, and our communities, and we strive for excellence in everything we do. Because life at CIBC is not only what you do, but how you do it.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

What You’ll Be Doing

As a Senior Consultant – Infrastructure Data Analytics, you will be supporting the financial and contractual governance of our outsourced technology and cloud infrastructure services.  You will use a variety of tools and processes to create meaningful analytics from both structured and unstructured data.  These outputs will be used to provide effective decision support guidance for our internal partners and senior executives.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Data Engineering and Data Science – Must have an awareness of current tools and methods used to support data engineering and data science analytics to provide insight and decision support for Senior Executives and management within CIBC.  Determine strategies for data integrity validation processes, optimization of data throughput, accessibility, and error-handling for tools to deliver ETL solutions.
  • Evaluate new tools and techniques and make recommendations to improve real-time and batch data access, transformation and movement across heterogeneous technologies and platforms.
  • Identify opportunities for new initiatives; make recommendations for increasing scalability and robustness of ETL platforms and solutions.
  • Financial Management Expertise – Must have prior work experience with core financial management and accounting activities such as planning, forecasting, accruals, and financial variance reporting. 
  • Information Technology Outsourcing and Public Cloud – Must have previous experience with, and a working understanding of outsourced information technology and public cloud infrastructure.
  • Creative Problem Solving – Demonstrated ability to thrive in ambiguity, understand business context quickly and connect the dots. Must be comfortable operating at a strategic level and also driving into detail as needed, and back. Continuous improvement is part of your DNA.

KNOWLEDGE/SKILL REQUIREMENTS

Subject Matter Expertise:

  • Logical Data Modeling--Knowledge of activities, tasks, processes, deliverables and techniques for analyzing and documenting conceptual/logical data models to capture domain knowledge and business rules.
  • Database Structures--Knowledge of a database management structures (relational, hierarchical., distributed...) and associated platforms

Extensive Work Experience:

  • Modeling: Data, Process, Events, Objects--Knowledge of activities, tasks, processes, deliverables and techniques for analyzing and documenting logical relationships among the data, process or events.
  • Accuracy/Attention to Detail--Ability to process information with high levels of accuracy.

Work Experience:

  • Problem Solving--Knowledge of approaches, tools, techniques for recognizing, anticipating, and resolving organizational, operational or process problems.
  • Database Structures--Knowledge of a database management structures (relational, hierarchical., distributed...) and associated platforms.
  • Data Movement Tools--Knowledge of tools, techniques and practices for movement of electronic data.

Who You Are

  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

item.title: Senior Manager, Automotive and Unsecured Lending Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

The Senior Manager, Automotive and Unsecured Lending Analytics will be a leading contributor in the Analytics & Decision Science team supporting Personal and Business Banking. The Analytics & Decision Science team focuses on creating next generation analytics assets to enable data-driven decision making for partners in Product, Marketing, Client Segment and Strategy. In this role, you will lead analytics engagements to evaluate client behaviours and optimize business decisions related to product, campaign, pricing and other business areas. You will present insights and make data-driven recommendations to senior leaders to help identify opportunities to grow the business and better serve our clients.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Consultant – be a leader in analytics consulting – Integrate deep domain knowledge with analytical capabilities to deliver value to stakeholders, enable data-driven decision making and proactively identify opportunities to drive business growth (projects/business cases, acquisition/retention campaigns, pricing, channels, segments, products and process enhancements).
  • Analytics – Independently identify and leverage the right statistical techniques (descriptive, predictive, prescriptive) to extract actionable insights out of client behaviours and business trends (both internal and external).  Appropriately integrate of big data, business intelligence, visualization, self-service and analytical tools into engagements.  Proactively explore new applications of advanced analytics to innovate and build strategic analytics assets.
  • Technology – Leverage big data/analytical tools to analyze large structured and unstructured datasets, build data pipeline and visualization from multiple data sources.
  • Ownership – Orchestrate end-to-end delivery of solutions that meet stakeholder requirements and contribute to business success – you will think and act like an owner in analytics initiatives ensuring the proper identification and translation of business needs into analytics requirements.
  • Communication – Find the story in data and be flexible in communicating at varying levels of details for the right audience.

Who You Are

  • You have a degree in a quantitative field (i.e. mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, engineering, physics, business) or equivalent experience. Advanced degree is an asset (i.e. MMA, MBAN, MSc, MA, MBA).
  • You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business problems and recommend solutions.
  • You are proficient in programming languages and have experience using modern big data, analytical and dashboard tools (i.e. SAS, SQL, Python, R, Hadoop, Spark, Alteryx, Tableau, Cognos).
  • You have experience in building end-to-end analytics solutions involving large datasets (i.e. requirement gathering, data extraction, cleaning and transformation, statistical analysis, presentation & implementation).
  • You have working knowledge of statistical techniques (i.e. regression, time-series analysis, clustering, decision trees).
  • You are an avid learner who recognizes the analytics field is constantly evolving. You seek to explore emerging trends and best practices in the industry and are excited to share the knowledge with others.
  • You can be clearly understood. You have very strong communication and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present information to groups and individuals at all levels in the organization.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

item.title: UI/User Experience Designer
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

You’ll join our Capital Markets, Total Risk Management Technology group. The Senior Consultant, User Experience is a seasoned expert responsible for driving a digital-first user experience to increase client engagement and achieve business goals. The role uses deep knowledge in their field of expertise to plan and coordinate business tasks and deliverables, running digital design projects with minimal oversight. The Senior Consultant, User Experience analyzes situations and data using in-depth evaluation of intangibles, using human centered design to translate user needs and business requirements into award winning digital experiences. The role exercises considerable judgement for decision making on complex issues, providing art direction, design, and user experience thought leadership to ensure holistic client experiences in terms of usability standards. The role often operates in ambiguous situations and provides innovative, original ideas, accountable to broadly defined policy objectives.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Design - Develop user interface designs for mobile and desktop applications, artefacts, and project deliverables . Develop concept sketches, high fidelity wireframes, graphical assets, prototypes and interactive mock-ups, usability test plans and evaluations
  • Research and Present - Conduct  user research, user interface documentation. Deliver concept and design presentations.
  • Teamwork– Promote both user-centered and client-centered designs to project peers in a collaborative way.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate a minimum of 8+ years of UX research experience. As a Lead critical research efforts and conduct complex multi-phase, mixed-method studies that deepen our understanding of the user experience and drive product strategy.
  • Extensive experience in graphic, UI, or UX design with experience in enterprise application and using data-driven analytics
  • Strong technical understanding of and expertise in visual design practice theory / visual design tools; strong working knowledge of visual design methodologies
  • Experience leading a workstream within a project and/or cross-team and synthesizing feedback and input from a variety of teams.
  • Experience with user testing and qualitative usability testing.
  • Experience designing and launching digital products.
  • Work in a highly collaborative fashion as a strategic partner to business leads, product owners, and engineers to define both the long-term strategy and the short-term tactics for our products by grounding these decisions in user needs and insights
  • Prioritize research needs and approaches across multiple work streams to work on the right project, scale, and scope at the right time and ensure impact by delivering actionable insights
    Determine and recommend the most efficient and effective user-centered research approaches (qualitative and quantitative) to solve for business needs, meet agreed-upon objectives, and guide business areas through the appropriate UX process.
  • Lead foundational research activities that explore the problem space, frame the problems to be solved, and gather enough evidence and initial direction to define what to do next.
    Monitor UX project execution, including establishing and tracking UX project metrics and UX product scorecards.
  • Experience in UX research on SaaS solutions.
  • Experience conducting qualitative and quantitative research throughout an Agile development process.
  • Experience with using data analytics to identify UX research course of action a plus.
  • Has comprehensive understanding of visual design theory, research data and best practices to design high complexity visual artifacts and facilitate interaction .
  • Creates complex mock-ups and prototypes to communicate intent, or delivery specifications for development.
  • Creates visual components considering the broader context, to be used in multiple situations, to bring about efficiency and consistency and create delight by using the principles of design in a manner that both engages with the user .Uses dynamic visualizations to support analytic thinking .
  • Ensures visual displays, components, color and type meet the specified accessibility requirements.
  • Using the right research method to understand a user problem, guides team and business on test planning best practices, creates and executes against test plans for IA and Usability tests through both moderated and unmoderated sessions and Leads visual design projects / group tasks.
  • You have a degree/diploma in Computer Science, Engineering, Industrial Design, Business, Information Studies, Cognitive Psychology, Product Design or related fields.
  • You\'re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.
